alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 1:42PM MST until January 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 5500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 5500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Grand Canyon, North Rim, Prescott and Valle. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 PM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Snow forecast from 5 PM Today to 11 PM Tuesday: Grand Canyon 8 to 12 inches North Rim 17 to 23 inches Prescott 1 to 2 inches Valle 4 to 6 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains
